item.title: Cats Bifunctor
item.description: The following will be a short and rather simple article about a useful function I recently learned about: bimap by cats. In cats and in some cases scala, types like Either, Validated, Option… are right biased. which means that when we call .map on them, the function applied in the map is only applied on the case of a right. Here are some examples: val either: Either[String, Int] = Right(2) val result: Either[String, Int] = either.
